column2: sheeba011557, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Caregiver)
column9: My husband is a new wonderful person with taking this drug. He has been taking stavzor for 3 years and it has been our wonder drug. No side effets and nothing but happiness in our home now..

column2: myson, 19-24 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: This medication has been a miracle for my adult son.  He started taking Stavzor 4 weeks ago.  His dose is up to 2000mg and he has had no side effects. It is working extremely well on his manic symptoms.

Iv'e taken every bi-polar med out there; almost ran out of options until stavzor.1000mg and my anger has subsided quite a bit.I'm much more mellow,the only thing is sleeping is difficult.Weight gain too.Remember though the benifits out weigh the side effects.

column2: Erin, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I was put on this medication for chronic migraines after being taken off Topamax, which was very effective but caused me severe joint pain. I take 250-500 mg a day, depending on how my symptoms have been, and that seems to be a good balance. I am not migraine-free like I was while on the Topamax, but it is quite effective. It has not caused any side effects, not even nausea, which I tend to get very easily on oral medications.

column2: usfbullsrule, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: Easy to swallow compared to Depakote.

column2: 25-34 Male  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: weight gain!!!!! but this med keeps my anger out of sight. no altercations in over a year

column2: usfbullsrule, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I used to take two 500mg Depakote but they were like horse pills - difficult to swallow and sometimes gag. I gained weight on Depakote.  Then the pharmacy or insurance company switched it to generic - they were horrible - smelled nasty.  The doctor changed it to stavzor and  these smaller gelcaps are much easier to swallow - this is a big improvement - no more gagging.

column2: beagle bay-bee,  Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: At first in the mornings my speach was slered and had that drug hangover feeling, after a few hours it was gone. Im up to 1000mg so far so good its working for me for the past 4mos. the downside, i am gaining weight, i feel "poofy" since i been on the meds and my period is almost non exsistant. anyone else feeling the same as well?

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Hope this helps. I am newly diagnosed and have only been on Stavzor for a little over two weeks. It has considerably improved my mood! Some light side effects I have gotten are; diahrea, feeling drugged at a couple of intervals, restless sleeping, nausea and a missed period. But please note, the effects listed have been light. Overall, so far, the benefits outweigh the risks but always be very aware of what you're body is telling you.
